title: Understanding Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) - Ledger
summary:
Understanding Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
============================================

The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) is a virtual computer that distributes information across the entire Ethereum network, executing smart contracts and updating the state of the blockchain. It is responsible for the magic behind the Ethereum blockchain, powering countless decentralized applications and other use cases across multiple blockchains. In this article, we will delve into the history of EVM, how it works, its advantages, and disadvantages, and the future of EVM.

History of EVM
--------------

Vitalik Buterin introduced the idea of Ethereum in 2013, creating a decentralized platform for building applications. Vitalik's idea eventually became the Ethereum network, and at the heart of that network is the EVM. EVM was developed to provide a secure and reliable environment for running decentralized applications (dApps).

title: The Ethereum Beacon Chain: Explained - Ledger
summary: The Ethereum Beacon Chain is a parallel chain that was created to facilitate the transition from the legacy Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism to the alternative Proof-of-Stake (PoS) system in 2022. The Beacon Chain introduced PoS to the Ethereum ecosystem and established new parameters for governance, validator operations, staking rewards, and other changes related to the PoS system. The Beacon Chain did not process any smart contract transactions, but instead conducted the network of Ethereum stakers before they started validating real Ethereum transactions. The Beacon Chain was merged with the original PoW chain to formalize PoS as Ethereum's consensus mechanism in September 2022, and the Beacon Chain became part of the new Ethereum PoS network. The impact of the Beacon Chain includes the introduction of staking to the network, the ability to scale the network through sharding, and the potential for future upgrades to the network's capabilities.

title: What is Staking? Crypto's Most Common 'Passive Income' Strategy Explained - DailyCoin
summary:
Here are the key points from the article about staking in cryptocurrency:

1. What is staking in cryptocurrency? Staking is a way to earn passive income on your digital assets by contributing them to a blockchain network and helping to secure it.
2. What is the Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism? PoS is a method used by some blockchains to produce new blocks and secure the network. Instead of using computational power to solve complex mathematical problems, as in the Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism, PoS relies on validators to lock up their staking coins and participate in the consensus process.

title: What is the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade? - Ledger
summary: The Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade is a major upgrade scheduled for April 12th that will introduce the ability to withdraw staked ETH and rewards from the Beacon Chain. This upgrade is a significant step towards the continued development of the Ethereum protocol and has the potential to increase accessibility and flexibility for users, improve scalability and security, and open up new developments in Ethereum's future. The upgrade will allow validators to withdraw their staked ETH and cash out their rewards, with some limitations on the number of withdrawals in each block. The upgrade also includes the Shapella upgrade, which is the final step towards Ethereum's move from proof-of-work (PoW) to proof-of-stake (PoS).
